revised_title: The Application of nth Order Equations in Describing Haemolysis Reactions
tldr: The authors introduce a modification to the theory of haemolytic reactions, treating the reaction between lysin and cell components as nth order instead of first order. This modification allows for more accurate and diverse descriptions of haemolytic phenomena, using time-dilution curves and percentage haemolysis curves. The authors also develop a new method for measuring percentage haemolysis using a potassium cell and a rotating shutter system.
